reviews.sentence: Pleasant helpful staff. Nice appearance of lobby and rooms. Good heating system even temperature. Convenient to the US Grant which is where we were attending a wedding. Nice touch with robes and slippers. Good hair dryer. Bathroom needed updating. Walls are very thin can hear others in rooms next door and hallway. Lighting in bathroom is a bit harsh.

Comfortable well priced and a good location. The Bristol Hotel bedrooms are great. Very comfortable wel equipped. great beds and clean. Service was also efficient and friendly. The hotel lobby does not reflect the quality of the hotel. Only one person on the desks trying to handle telephone calls and guest enquiries. The location being a couple of blocks from The Gas Lamp District was great. Very happy with the hotel and good value.

Nice hotel in downtown San Diego. My overall experience with this hotel was very pleasing. For being in downtown it was very quiet except for the occasional trolley going by. The hotel was clean and appeared to be of good quality. My room was quite spacious more so than I was expecting. There was no view from my room but would not expect too much being downtown anyway. The food from the in hotel restaurant was good but fairly expensive albeit everything is more expensive in San Diego than in the Midwest where I am from. Quiet atmosphere courteous and helpful staff and good proximity. Hotel food is more expensive than I think it is worth. The lobby computer available for printing etc was too slow and did not work.

good for business. I used this hotel for my family trip to San Diego. I ordered a crib for my baby three times when I made a reservation the day before arrival and checked in however it was never delivered. Also Expedia said it had a refregirator in the room but it was a free option. The facility of the showerom was little old and flashing system of the bathroom was broken down. The room was enough clean.

Decent hotel. Stayed at this hotel right after staying at the Sophia Hotel that is next door. The room itself was larger in size than the Sophia. The bathroom was ok but looked like it had been remodeled but not well. The ceiling in the bathroom was very low. The workout room is terrible especially after seeing the great one at the Sophia. The aerobic equipment is quite old. The TVs attached did not work. There were only a few dumbbells and no benches. it is also quite dark small and isolated. There were not ice machines on every floor only 3rd and 8th floor. The ice machine room was not laid out well. There was a swinging door but the machine was located where you had to stand right behind this door when getting ice so you had get hit if someone else came in.

Great room very clean. But found puke surprise. It was great. Worth for what we were paying for I just wish there came a lobby breakfast along with the Stay. And our neighbors threw up all over our front door and floor. We were not affiliated with them at all. That was uncaled for. They almost were going to charge me had I not called and requested late checkout. Probably could have gotten a discount for that or hotel credit. So be aware of those party people staying in.

Very comfortable old classic hotel. This older downtown hotel is clean comfortable and modern. For its older look the accommodations are more on the modern side. it is cute and we will located. It was much more affordable than other places I considered. I would stay again.
Fake Weight Equipment. I only picked this hotel because of the picture they have of the fitness room. The one at the hotel is totally different and has no weights or bench.

Hotel lacks basic amenities. The hotel is located at the heart of downtown but it lacks room service microwave and you have to request housekeeping to bring you a refrigerator. Rather than supplying each room with a 50 microwave they recommend you to lug your food to the 7 Eleven around the corner infested with homeless people and request to use there is. If it had not been for me reviewing another persons review I would not have known to request the refrigerator as it was not mentioned during check in. You do not realize that certain basic items are luxuries until you stay here. The room was clean and the location was good but I can not stay here anymore knowing that the essentials are missing.

Loved the piano player in the lobby. Lovely hotel. Nice area easy to walk to nearby restaurants and bars. I understand they close the bar early often due to low demand but for me this was a disappointment as I love to cap off and or start my night out st the hotel bar where I am staying and meet other guests chat wIth the bartenders. My only complaint was that when you advertise a bar lounge as an amenity it should be available at all stated hours as this could have been a factor in making the booking. I especially loved that one of the fr My desk staff was playing the piano in the lobby one eve when I came home and I sat in the lobby and listened for a while.
Nice rooms and hotel with gym on the top level. Parking is restricted to valet only. Over 30 per night. Close to Horton plaza.
nice boutique hotel. we stayed in a recently renovated room. it was really cute and nice. the hotel gym was clean and busy in the evening. good location walkable.

Great place to stay. I liked the room decor and the amenities for someone coming from a rural area it was a nice gesture to have the earplugs by the bedside. The room was very clean. I liked that there was not carpeting in the room as I feel like those tend to trap a lot of dirt and debris. The bartender was very friendly too had a great conversation with her about books and tv shows.

Good location. It has a brand new gym on the 9th floor that has everything you need. Nice eating area with fair breakfast. We did n’t hear any noises through the night. The staff were exceptionally nice. Rooms are clean with wood floors that is much much better than carpet for a hotel room.

Cute but noisy hotel in Downtown San Diego. The lobby and the rooms are both decorated in an modern style that I liked. The room was comfortable but a bit small and quite loud from street noise. Our room was on the 6th floor so not street level. The hotel supplies earplugs on the bedside table so they must be aware of the problem. Would be better to put in double paned windows.

Excellent hotel away from the tourist scene. The staff was amazing. They made me feel like a VIP addressing me by name from the minute I arrived as if I was the only guest they were expecting. The room was stylish without being overly fussy. The lobby was bright and comfortable. The location was very convenient to restaurants transportation and other resources in downtown San Diego.

Excellent caring staff. Front desk was very accommodating and all of the staff was affable pleasant. Ismael works as front desk supervisor very knowledgeable about the area and took care of us. Cianika worked the Pm shift very sweet and immediately got whatever we requested towels toiletries etc.

Great. Great location great staff and great facilities. I arrived early and there was no problem with an early check in. The staff were very nice. I am very satisfied with my stay and would definitely stay there again if I am in town.

Great location and superb accommodations. The Bristol is located in the centre of San Diego and within 15 minutes walking distance of many of the attractions that you must see in the city. For sight seeing a little further the hop on hop off bus stop is only minutes walk from the Bristol. Grocery shopping is an easy 10 minute walk and the number of restaurants within easy access is amazing. The hotel staff were so friendly and the room so comfortable. We drove from Arizona to the Bristol and they have valet car parking for a fee of US 390 per day but all of the other parades in the area are similarly priced. I ’d heartily recommend the Bristol for it ’s central location and superior service. Nothing.
